article.headline: Charlotte 94, TCU 86 (OT)
article.story: FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) -- Curtis Withers scored six of his 21 points in overtime to help Charlotte to a 94-86 win over TCU on Wednesday night. The game was tied at 81-81 at the end of regulation, but Charlotte (18-6, 10-3 Conference USA) opened the overtime period with nine unanswered points keyed by a two free throws and a jumper by Withers to take a 90-81 lead. TCU (10-14, 6-7) cut the lead to 90-86 with 38 seconds left, but Charlotte added four free throws, including two by Withers, to hold on for the win. TCU trailed 81-79 before Aaron Curtis made two free throws with 2:32 left in the second half to tie the game and force overtime. Charlotte got 31 points from Brendan Plavich and Butter Johnson added 13. Corey Santee scored 20 and Chudi Chinweze had 14 for TCU.
